1. vim edits

    1.  Multicursor
    Ctrl+n ESC i  https://github.com/terryma/vim-multiple-cursors 
    #delete between quotes like { } ''" "etc
    mode:Normal di'' di{ di(
                dw #delete a word
                cw #delete with insert
    2. selection
    mode:visual gg and G
    3. nerd commenting
    mode:Normal 
    space+c+c
    #uncommenting
    space+c+space
    4. find in files
    :Rg 'text'
    5.  moving horizontly
    f<> t<>
    F<> T<>
    ; - move forward
    , - move backward
    6.  delete
    dw - delete word
    cw - delete + insert
    s - delete insert
    x - delete
    D - deletes further content
    C - put insert mode
    S - delete and put in proper indentation
    7. creating dir and files 
    press 'm' in nerdtree
    then you get optiions
    map <C-p> :ProjectFiles<CR>
    8.  setting up python for coc
    :CocCommand
    python.setInterpreter
    9.  verticle movement
    Ctrl + d Ctrl+u
    {  }- move between chunk of codes
    relative numbers
    % - matching braces
    i and a - for selection inside brackets
    10. git feature
    jump to next hunk (change): ]c
    11. tab experience
    gt # go to next
    gT #back
    12. git merge
    C - w - o #leave only this blank
    13. formating
    <leader> f
    14. visual mode selection 
    sh + v + > or < 
    15. vim-surround
        ysiw{}
        yss{}
    16. auto-formating
        g=G
    17. align
        gapi - https://github.com/junegunn/vim-easy-align
